Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> Noticed KMD is on the Ledger hardware wallets, is there any chance VRSC will be too at some future point?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @ABK We definitely expect hardware wallet support at some point. Our primary focus right now is PBaaS, which is a broad effort across a number of areas of dev and has started to include business development as well. While we don't want to talk about potential opportunities prematurely, so as to respect confidentiality and also avoid anything resembling hype, we believe there is no single thing we could be focused on that has more potential for value and use of Verus at this time.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> Thanks for the reply Mike, makes perfect sense.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> Verus seems to have a very different community to the usual ICO & Dump crowd, so not sure the DEX listing will be too detrimental

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> I really think this and many listings for the right reasons are only positive, not detrimental. If people wanted to dump Verus, they already have the ability to do so. People sell and there is some volume, but many just don't want to sell at these prices. The closest thing I saw to dumping was when secret mining gave a very small number of people the ability to mine coins much less expensively than everyone else, and we had some people with many coins who had no idea why they should care about the project besides they could snipe it. Right now, a new exchange, especially a DEX with a lot of customers who don't yet know about Verus, will only spread awareness and provide some additional liquidity, that will be more important when PBaaS is released to prevent giant pumps, which are also not healthy, IMO. It should also secure CMC listing, which is another way to spread awareness. In the case of Verus, I see a risk in many small listings, which isn't as much about more selling as it is a distraction from what's important. I think Crypto Bridge listing is only positive, and I'm grateful that we have a community that could pull together as we did to make it happen.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gloryman> @miketout I agree. I have been trading Verus more now recently. There are some big sales of the coin going on but in never pushes the price much below 2900. Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <miketout> btw, with all that said, I hope that people both buying and selling Verus could spread the volume around on the exchanges that do support us. show them all a little love ðŸ˜‰ 
@Gloryman the vision paper describes that. there are companies talking about leveraging PBaaS beyond the foundational applications described in the vision paper, which are polls, elections, identity, but nothing I could disclose at this time, since those are companies, not our community project itself. Have you read the vision paper? You might want to take a look, if not: https://veruscoin.io/downloads/papers/VerusVision.pdf

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> identity is after that. i am extremely confident that once released, it will not be hard to understand. it is all i can do to keep up with both building it and spending time, which I enjoy, with people who would like to discuss using it for some very exciting use cases.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gloryman> @miketout Do you mine if I try to create a game that the Verus community could play using the voting polls. I take it we can just create a PBaaS in the wallet and then other wallet users can vote and stuff.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> there isn't really a way to do that until PBaaS, but I'd be happy to help then. right now, my focus is on building it. also, when I say talking to people, I mean big, corporate use cases that will build revenue generating businesses. I believe that I should at least use a little of my time to encourage those kinds of efforts as I build PBaaS, for the benefit of the project and community. I will not be able to generally help people know how to build on PBaaS until it is working. after that, I'd love to see you and others use it for many things.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> @miketout hey are we vulnerable to this?  https://www.ccn.com/25-crypto-networks-vulnerable-to-fake-stake-attack-are-your-funds-at-risk/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> miketout answered:
```Verus validates all PoS blocks fully, including unspent state of source UTXO. the attacks would not work as described against Verus, both for those reasons and notarization```
Regarding: <https://medium.com/@dsl_uiuc/fake-stake-attacks-on-chain-based-proof-of-stake-cryptocurrencies-b8b05723f806>
